meanings.definition: To outdo in capering or frolicking.
meanings.sent1: The playful puppy was outcapering all the other dogs at the park.
meanings.sent2: The children were outcapering each other in the game of tag.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was outcapering the birds in the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outcapered the sound of the wind in the trees.
meanings.sent5: The energetic dance troupe outcapered all others with their lively performance.

meanings.definition: The act of outdoing in capering or frolicking.
meanings.sent1: The outcapering of the kids in the playground brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent2: The outcapering of the kittens chasing each other was a joy to watch.
meanings.sent3: The outcapering of the squirrel as it leaped from branch to branch was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The outcapering of the waves against the shore was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The outcapering of the clown at the circus delighted the audience.
